meanings.definition: To bring together into one group or place.
meanings.sent1: Let's gather all the toys in the toy box.
meanings.sent2: The family will gather for dinner at 6 pm.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to gather all their stuffed animals for a tea party.
meanings.sent4: The stars gather in the night sky, creating a beautiful display.
meanings.sent5: The students gather around the teacher, eager to hear the story.

meanings.sent1: She likes to gather seashells on the beach.
meanings.sent2: The farmer will gather the ripe fruits from the orchard.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to gather as many acorns as possible before winter.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gather ominously in the sky.
meanings.sent5: He would gather coins from different countries as a hobby.

meanings.sent1: They gather apples from the tree in the backyard.
meanings.sent2: The workers will gather the crops from the fields.
meanings.sent3: The chef will gather fresh herbs from the garden for the soup.
meanings.sent4: The bees gather nectar from flowers to make honey.
meanings.sent5: She would gather flowers from the meadow to make a bouquet.
